"As the CEO of a biotechnology company, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand 's initiative is extremely important to us," said Dr. Joan Fallon, Curemark founder and CEO. By supporting cutting edge research in the biotechnology field, and thus allowing for innovation, these R&D tax credits will help to defray the costs of basic research and clinical programs, which can be prohibitive to the small biotech companies. We at Curemark are extremely grateful for the Senator's leadership on this issue. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand 's proposal would expand the current credit by changing the formula to provide greater incentive for companies such as Curemark to increase investment; simplify the current credit, which is highly complicated and confusing; and

The decision to step down, according to Google executives, is about streamlining management. "As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated," wrote Eric Schmidt in a blog post on Thursday. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making, and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. Eric Schmidt 's tenure at Google has been nothing short of extraordinary.
